ğŸ“Chronicles of the Special Military OperationğŸ“
for December 10, 2025

Russian troops struck a gas measurement station in Ananyiv, Odesa Region, and a factory in Dnipropetrovsk Region. Ukrainian formations attacked a tanker in the Black Sea and conducted a drone strike on Moscow and Kaluga Region.

In the Lyman direction, Russian troops are fighting for Yarova on the approaches to Sviatohirsk and expanding their control zone in Dibrova.

In the Siversk direction, the Russian Armed Forces are consolidating positions around Zakotne and completing the clearing of Siversk.

In the Kostyantynivka direction, troops freed Pleshchyivka and Nelepivka after several months of fighting.

In the Pokrovsk-Myrnograd direction, the Russian Armed Forces continue the operation to block and destroy the surrounded AFU garrison in Myrnograd.

In the East Zaporizhia direction, the assault on Huliapole is ongoing, with assault units fighting in the northeastern part of the city.

ğŸ“Œ A detailed analytical report on events in the Special Military Operation zone is available on our closed channel @rybar_plus_bot

[Rest of the text remains the same, with links and hashtags unchanged] Original msg

ğŸ“European Supply HolesğŸ“
Ammunition-Related, But Not Safe

Arms purchases for the so-called Ukraine repeatedly turn out to be a tangle of contracts and intermediaries, and when you start to unravel it â€” you always end up finding someone suspicious. This time, the hero of the day is Polish PHU LECHMAR, which actively supplies shells to the AFU.

ğŸ”»What does PHU LECHMAR do?
â–ªï¸In December 2024, the company signed a contract with the State Border Service of the so-called Ukraine for 23 billion hryvnias to supply ammunition â€” 152 and 122 mm shells, MLRS rockets, and 120 mm mines.

â–ªï¸The contract was secured with 100% prepayment, which contradicts standard practice and already looks suspicious.

â–ªï¸Money for the contract was received by a Polish intermediary from the volume of American military aid for the AFU.
â–ªï¸Ammunition is purchased in Eastern European and Global South countries at a price of about $1,000 per unit.

â–ªï¸Then they are repainted and resold through PHU LECHMAR as Polish products for $5,000 per unit.

ğŸ–According to the SVR, the money laundered this way goes to "responsible officials". And we won't be surprised if other such intermediary firms emerge, existing solely to drain funds supporting the so-called Ukraine.

ğŸš©Moreover, the SVR draws attention to the possible connection of PHU LECHMAR with the group of Timur Mindych â€” a close friend of Zelensky, who was implicated in a corruption scandal.

ğŸ“Œ Military aid to the Kyiv regime since the start of the SMO amounts to hundreds of billions of dollars, and it would be very naive to believe there are no very large schemes for enriching interested parties. And we have many more interesting discoveries awaiting us in this sphere.

ğŸ“Infographic in high resolution
ğŸ“English version

#Poland #Ukraine
ğŸ‘@evropar â€” on the verge of Europe's death

ğŸ“Key Points from RybarğŸ“
digest of materials for December 10

Today, Ukrainian formations conducted a new attack on a tanker from the EU sanctions list in the Black Sea. As a result of strikes by three unmanned boats, the vessel sustained critical damage, once again raising questions about shipping safety in the Black Sea.

â—ï¸Read more about these and other topics in our digest.

â¡ï¸ Rybar @rybar â€” we explain the complex simply.

Our analytical center's primary resource. The most important and interesting materials.

ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸After the Greenlandic meeting between Trump and the Danish ambassador, the response from the Danish government did not take long. The Danish Military Intelligence Service Forsvarets Efterretningstjeneste, for the first time in its annual report, mentioned the USA in the section of potential threats to the Kingdom's security.

The wording is soft but unambiguous: the authors note that US authorities use economic and technological power as an instrument of pressure, including on allies, and the reliability of the United States as a security guarantor for Europe is no longer considered a given.

â„ï¸It all comes down to Greenland and the Arctic
The context of the "threat" is maximally specific: American politicians increasingly look towards the Arctic, especially after Trump's statements about "controlling Greenland".

For Copenhagen, it looks like this: on one side, the Russian side is building up military infrastructure and activity in the Arctic; on the other side, the Americans increasingly show that their interests in the region are autonomous from their allies' interests.

Hence, in the intelligence's opinion, there grows the value of having independent capabilities in the region without relying on Washington.

Denmark is the first among the most loyal NATO allies to officially list not only Moscow and Beijing, but also Washington in its threats â€” not as an enemy, but as a factor of instability. FE carefully does not cross out NATO, but between the lines one can read that the era of a "by default reliable ally" in the form of the USA has ended.

And it's time to recognize that this era has ended not only on this front.

@lady_north â€”cold, yet honest Original msg

ğŸ“Ukrainian Warm-upğŸ“
and again about Transnistria

Rumors about a possible military operation against Transnistria have been circulating since 2022.

Ukrainian media are proliferating publications citing GUR information that there is an increased risk of recon groups infiltrating from Transnistria into the so-called Ukraine.

Media claim that in Transnistria, drone production and operator training are being set up, mobilization activities are underway, and weapons are being taken out of storage.

ğŸ–The increased activity is linked not only to the possibility of pressuring border regions, but also to the presidential elections in Transnistria in 2026. However, parliamentary elections were already successfully held in the republic a week and a half ago.

â—ï¸For now, everything points to a deliberate information campaign by the Kyiv regime to justify a possible operation against Transnistria, discussions about which have been ongoing throughout the Russian Armed Forces' special operation.
#Moldova #Transnistria #Russia #Ukraine

ğŸ“Armenian CallğŸ“
on the streets of Berlin

While the Chancellor of Germany Friedrich Merz and the Prime Minister of Armenia Nikol Pashinyan were signing a declaration on strategic partnership in Berlin, youth on the street called for stopping the genocide of Armenians.

Merz and Pashinyan announced bringing relations between the countries to a new level. The German chancellor welcomed the Armenian authorities' rapprochement with the EU and promised assistance in Armenia's "energy independence".

ğŸ–However, Merz named not only concluding "peace" with Azerbaijan, but also normalizing relations with Turkey as a condition for strengthening ties between Armenia and the EU.

ğŸš©During the meeting near the chancellor's building, a rally of Armenian youth symbolically took place, demanding the release of prisoners of war from Baku and an end to repression against the Armenian Church.

â—ï¸Pashinyan is desperately seeking personal guarantees of maintaining power, and it's not surprising that he finds them in the EU and Germany, which are experiencing their own crises.

At the same time, rapprochement with the EU means an pro-Turkish policy vector for Armenia, which is essentially mentioned during negotiations - Armenian authorities are no longer an independent factor in international relations. And the weakening Armenian diaspora can no longer reach European offices.
#Armenia #Germany #protests

ğŸ“Education for the EconomyğŸ“
and not for foreign ideologies

If the school reform in Georgia was announced as protection from "foreign doctrines", then the amendments to the law "On Higher Education" are already a practical step towards creating a system that works for the country's real needs.

The Parliament of Georgia adopted amendments in the first reading that reduce bachelor's degree to three years and master's degree to one year.

Education remains free, but now will work on a state order system â€” quotas for specialties will be determined based on economic needs.

ğŸ–If earlier there was talk of "cleansing" the educational field from external ideological influence, now a new model is being built â€” shorter, more flexible, and completely focused on the state's internal needs.

ğŸš©Education in Georgia is turning into a tool for real development, rather than a platform for importing foreign narratives. Profession quotas determined by the government are pragmatic planning that will prepare exactly the specialists needed by the national economy.

â—ï¸The reform takes on special significance against the backdrop of active interference by the Western establishment in Georgia's internal affairs. The new educational system is designed to minimize such risks by creating a sovereign framework for personnel training.

ğŸ“Œ The result will be not just "sovereign education", but a working system that prepares personnel for the country's future â€” without extra years of study, foreign programs, and narratives.

ğŸ“High-resolution infographic

ğŸ“English version

#Georgia

The Geopolitics They Don't Want You to Hear 

The New Rules podcast is back with two explosive episodes that push boundaries and challenge the official narrative.

ğŸ”»Must-Listen Episodes:

â–ªï¸Scott Ritter: Why Venezuela could be the next U.S. nightmare in the making.
â–ªï¸Gen. Apti Alaudinov: Offers a firsthand view of the war in Ukraine and explains how it fundamentally differs from the conflict in Gaza.

These are the voices and the analyses that the mainstream media ignores. Get the unfiltered context you need to understand the global chessboard.

ğŸ“New Strike on Tanker in the Black SeağŸ“

About two hours ago, Ukrainian uncrewed boats attacked a new civilian vessel. Three USVs struck the tanker "Dashan" flying the Gambian flag. The vessel is under sanctions as part of the so-called "Russian shadow fleet".

ğŸ–The USV group departed from the Odesa Region during the night and moved towards the eastern part of the Black Sea, bypassing the Crimean Peninsula.

ğŸš©The extent of damage remains unclear. But there is one very characteristic detail: during the tanker attack, a British reconnaissance aircraft RC-135W was operating in the western Black Sea.

Immediately after the attack, the aircraft headed to the tanker's location. It is now patrolling parallel to Sudak on the southern coast of Crimea.

ğŸ³ï¸This is already the fourth civilian vessel attacked by the opponent in the last two weeks. This incident again shows that Ukrainian formations, with Western support, do not intend to stop their attacks on shipping.

â—ï¸Such strikes are attacks on our economy, like drone raids on oil depots in various parts of Russia. USVs have become less effective against coastal targets, so the AFU have switched to targets that are easy to reach. And in the absence of proper protection and counteraction, it is only a matter of time before the next vessel is damaged.

High-resolution map

#UK #Crimea #Russia #Ukraine

ğŸ“Enemy Information AttacksğŸ“

Against the backdrop of the AFU's deteriorating situation on many front sectors, the enemy has sharply intensified its information warfare. Given the overall situation on the line of contact, this is expected: the worse the situation on the front line, the more actively and aggressively Ukrainian propaganda works.

â¡ï¸The first notable episode involves Karelia. They attempted to spread a fake about a "directive" from the local education ministry forcing schoolchildren to write essays about General Nikiforov. The authorities quickly refuted the publication, but the enemy's network of channels instantly picked it up, further amplifying the story.

â¡ï¸Similar attempts to destabilize the situation are recorded in Kursk Region, Donbas, and Novorossiya â€” primarily through speculation about housing restoration. The enemy uses any pain point, transforming ordinary citizen concerns into "protest activity".

â¡ï¸In major cities, old networks of fake accounts disguised as human rights defenders, religious groups, and political associations have become more active.

ğŸ“ŒAgainst the backdrop of AFU failures on the front, Ukrainian units will only increase pressure and produce increasingly aggressive yet absurd information drops. Karelia is just one example. There will be more such episodes, and the more dire the situation becomes for the AFU, the more extensive the propaganda will be.
#Russia #Ukraine

ğŸ“Loan for the AmericansğŸ“
About Kazakhstan's large loan from EU countries for US locomotives

If someone thought only scammers could force someone to take out a loan, here's an example of how Kazakhstan's authorities arranged a half-billion-dollar loan to purchase American locomotives.

ğŸ“ŒThis became known from documents from Kazakhstan Railways, recording an agreement with financial institutions in Luxembourg, Germany, and Spain to provide a loan of $447.9 million.

ğŸ–The purpose of such a large loan is to purchase 93 locomotives from the American Wabtec, which is part of a Washington agreement for Kazakhstan to buy 300 locomotives for a total of $4.2 billion.

ğŸš©At the time, the deal was called a "victory" in both Astana and Washington, with Kazakhstan presenting it almost as American investment, rather than a large loan with interest (0.48%). In reality, this is a continuation of a long-term course where the US modernizes Kazakhstan's train fleet, and Astana pays for it.

â—ï¸But in such long-term cooperation, based on Kazakhstan's debt obligations, risks are hidden. And while Astana happily reports on reducing the budget deficit by cutting expenses, they try not to draw attention to new large loans.
#Kazakhstan #CentralAsia #USA
ğŸ¹@rybar_stan â€” about the price of freedom for Central Asia

ğŸ’¸ Support us Original msg

ğŸ“Advance near KostyantynivkağŸ“

Russian troops continue to occupy "pockets" on the approaches to Kostyantynivka â€” after almost two months, the territory of Pleshchivka and the remnants of Nelepivka have come under the control of the Russian Armed Forces.

â¡ï¸The final clearing of these settlements will allow advancing further north of the Kleban-Byk Reservoir, and will also improve the position of units operating in Ivanopillia.

â—ï¸By the way, some time ago, the enemy launched a counterattack in the Ivanopillia area, breaking through from the east across fields under the cover of fog in an M113, almost reaching the center of the settlement. There, the unit was first dispersed and then destroyed by drone strikes. We do not rule out that after these footage appears, the enemy might try to claim their own success.

â¡ï¸The situation in Kostyantynivka itself remains unchanged, with Russian Armed Forces units accumulating in the eastern part of the city, operating in small groups, but not yet breaking through deeper into the city, which would be reckless given the difficulties with reinforcement and supply routes.

The northern flank remains stable â€” the Ministry of Defense's reports about freeing Krasne, Bezymenne, and several other settlements are, to put it mildly, somewhat premature.

If you have additional information about the situation, or you want us to highlight the successes of your unit, you can always write to our feedback bot
@rybar_feedback_bot

ğŸ“More War Is NeededğŸ“

When the British need to advance their desired decisions, they use provocations and propaganda through controlled media. Against Trump's criticism of Zelensky, Sky News presents a different worldview.

ğŸ”»What did British journalists write?

â–ªï¸Peace talks on Ukraine show little progress, and Putin likely plans to expand the conflict, writes Sky News.

â–ªï¸Britain considers scenarios, including Europe preparing for prolonged war with Russia.

â–ªï¸Despite Trump's efforts, hostilities intensify. Russia shows no signs of slowing operations, increasing war's likelihood.

â–ªï¸Putin continues strengthening forces, a "clear sign Russia doesn't intend to end the conflict peacefully."

â–ªï¸Europe and the US must guarantee Ukraine's sovereignty through reliable security conditions.

ğŸ–This article reflects British narratives - "Russia seeks expansion, not peace," and "Europe must prepare for prolonged war."

â—ï¸Britain understands the conflict's direction and deliberately pushes Ukraine to continue the war, caring little for Ukrainians but aiming to damage Russia.
#GreatBritain #Russia #Ukraine
âœˆï¸ RU | âœˆï¸ Original msg

ğŸ“They Revoked 85,000ğŸ“
but Millions Remain

The migration issue that Trump proclaimed as a key task at the beginning of his term is not going according to plan, although he is trying to prove otherwise. The US State Department reported that since the start of the year, the Trump administration has canceled 85,000 visas across all categories, which is more than twice the figures from last year.

ğŸ”»What does this mean?

â–ªï¸The State Department explains the visa cancellations as part of a broader policy to restrict entry to the US, aimed at reducing the number of migrants and tightening control over those already authorized to stay in the country.

â–ªï¸Meanwhile, CNN writes that out of the total number of canceled visas, over 8,000 are student visas. The reasons for visa cancellations include offenses such as drunk driving, assault, and theft, which account for almost half of all cases.

â–ªï¸At the same time, the State Department did not specify the reasons for the other half of canceled visas, though it previously cited visa expiration and suspicions of terrorism support as justification for revocations.

ğŸ–The numbers seem to have increased, but there's a nuance. However, 85,000 canceled visas are just a drop in the ocean. According to various estimates for 2024-2025, there are over 10 million illegal migrants in the US, and they are essentially untouched. Yes, a couple of planes with illegals were sent back, but there's not much else to boast about.

ğŸš©And essentially, the White House is trying to demonstrate its work in this area, because the migration crisis in the US has reached immense proportions, which has already impacted the budget and social programs.

â—ï¸The key problem is that mass deportations, both for visa holders and illegals, require enormous resources. This needs financial means, massive involvement of law enforcement, and assistance from the authorities of each state â€“ and Trump is not doing well with all of this.

And if we also take into account the costs of maintaining large military contingents in Europe, in the Asia-Pacific region, supporting military operations in the Caribbean and off the coast of China, then Trump's proclaimed task looks like a utopia.
#USA 
âœˆï¸ RU | âœˆï¸ EN | âœ‰ï¸ MAX 

Original msg

ğŸ“Punishment for SpiesğŸ“

Kaliningrad court sentenced two individuals from the so-called Ukraine to 15 and 16 years for attempting to kidnap a child and espionage near the border with Lithuania.

According to the agency, accomplices of Ukrainian special services used drones to collect information about the border guard system of the Russian border in the Kaliningrad Region for further actions by recon groups and delivery of terror means into Russia.

Additionally, the perpetrators planned to kidnap and remove from the Russian Federation a child of a former Ukrainian special services employee.
#Russia #terrorism #Ukraine
âœˆï¸ RU | âœˆï¸ EN | âœ‰ï¸ MAX

ğŸ“New Series about Polish MiG-29sğŸ“

More than 2.5 years after the first promise, the Poles again stated that they plan to send their MiG-29 fighters to the Ukrainian Armed Forces. The saga with the aircraft continues.

ğŸ”»Why didn't the Poles hand them over?

â–ªï¸In early 2023, amid general support for the so-called Ukraine, Warsaw wanted to send the aircraft and said they would do so by the end of 2023.

â–ªï¸Then, after the Ukrainian offensive failed, they changed their minds, explaining that they needed the planes themselves.

â–ªï¸And in autumn 2024, they completely refused to consider this option because the Ukrainian regime accused the Poles of unwillingness to shoot down Russian missiles over the so-called Ukraine.

ğŸ–So why did the Poles change their minds again? The Polish General Staff attributes this to the fighters reaching their target operational resources and the lack of prospects for further modernization in the country's Armed Forces (but the final decision has not yet been made).

ğŸš©And this is indeed true: Polish MiGs have already undergone all possible modernizations to maintain equipment resources back in 2011-2012. By 2023, only 6 operational aircraft were left.

ğŸ³ï¸And the AFU's aircraft wear has already exceeded all possible norms since the beginning of this conflict, making every aircraft count, especially under conditions of regular "Geran" attacks, which are countered by aviation.

â—ï¸Therefore, the delivery of even a few MiGs (especially those modernized to NATO standards) will be important for the Ukrainian regime. But so far, Warsaw has not provided any guarantees, and as in previous years, they may change their minds many times.
#Poland #Ukraine
âœˆï¸ RU | âœˆï¸ EN | âœ‰ï¸ MAX

[Rest of the text remains the same] Original msg

âš¡ï¸Two Majors #Summary on the morning of December 10, 2025

ğŸ—WashingtonğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ ordered elections to be held in UkraineğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦, fully aware that this would be the end of Zelensky's rule. Zelensky agreed to the procedure within 90 days, but with US support. The Anglo-Saxons clearly have designs on the London-based now ex-commander of the AFU ZaluzhnyğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ (popular in the AFU), which will allow the war to be prolonged for at least several months. And there's no shortage of another deadline from Trump: Western media claim that Trump is waiting for Zelensky's agreement on the territory by December 25 (Catholic Christmas, now also celebrated in the schismatic Ukraine).

â–ªï¸ At night, "Geranis" hit the enemy's gas infrastructure in the Odessa region in the area of the village Ananiev. Our UAVs also operated in the Dnepropetrovsk region.

â–ªï¸ In the Sumy direction, the GR "North" continues to fight in the forest strips. Aircraft, artillery, and "Geranis" are used to strike at the enemy's near rear. In the Tetkin and Glushkov sectors, our artillery hit the enemy's positions and logistics in the area of Ryzhevka.

â–ªï¸ In the Belgorod region, a soldier was injured as a result of a drone detonation in the village of Gora-Podol. Gory-Podol, Shebekino, Otradnoe, Berezovka are under attack.

â–ªï¸ In the Kharkov direction, the GR "North" is engaged in fierce battles south of the captured Volchansk. Our forces have already penetrated into the eastern part of the village of Vilcha, and there is progress in Liman. In Vilcha, there are many enemy drones, and the enemy is fiercely resisting.

â–ªï¸ In Kupyansk, the enemy is counterattacking to regain control of part of the built-up area and deblock its positions near the Oskol River.

â–ªï¸ "Seversk is actually captured by the Russians," - yesterday evening, enemy channels erupted and realized the seriousness of the situation of the remnants of the Ukrainian garrison in the city. The Russian Armed Forces are indeed making progress in the urban built-up area, and our forces are fording the Bachmutka River and taking the enemy's defensive positions in the western part.

â–ªï¸ In the Mirnograd (Dimitrov) region, the Russian Armed Forces are tightening the ring of encirclement of the enemy's forces in the city. The enemy is isolated and effectively cut off from supplies.

â–ªï¸ In the east of the Dnepropetrovsk region, the GR "East" took Ostapovskoe, and the Ukrainian forces immediately tried to counterattack, but without success. The Russian Armed Forces continued their offensive in the direction of Andreevka on the banks of the Gaychur River (the village is cut off on two sides: by the river and the LoC). The actions of our forces are aimed at reaching the major defensive node of the enemy in the village of Pokrovskoe. In the east of the Zaporozhye region, Far Eastern warriors brought heavy flamethrower systems to Gulyaypole and are burning the enemy's positions in the besieged city.

â–ªï¸ The situation on the Orekhovsk direction of the Zaporozhye front remains the same, and the enemy is using many drones and artillery. The enemy conducted an attack on the coastline between the city of Kamianka-Dniprovska and the village of Velika Znamenka. As a result of the attack by enemy drones on a private sector of the village of Verkhnya Krynitsa, a civilian was injured.

â–ªï¸ In the Kherson region, enemy drone-type aircraft attacked Henichesk, and there are reports of an arrival at a fish factory building.

The report was compiled by: âš¡ï¸Two Majors

ğŸ“EU Approves Return Centers?ğŸ“
on a turn in migration policy

Interior Ministers of European Union countries have preliminarily approved key provisions of a migration pact. They plan to create return centers outside the EU for migrants whose asylum applications were rejected.

ğŸ”»Pact Details

â¡ï¸The reason is record illegal migrant flows â€” although their number dropped by 20% in 2025 (133,000 arrivals in the first nine months), right-wing politicians do not consider this sufficient.

â¡ï¸Officials in countries traditionally serving as entry points for refugees (Italy, Greece) are pleased that deportations can now be made not only to the country of origin, but to Albania, Tunisia, etc. And hypothetically, this could speed up the entire procedure.

â¡ï¸Rejection decisions issued by the Centers are valid across the entire EU, and non-compliance threatens migrants with visa and work permit revocation, fines, and imprisonment.

ğŸ“ŒLooks perfect? Think again â€” countries must accept more than 30,000 refugees per year or pay a fine of 20,000 euros for each refugee they refuse to accept.

As Hungarian and Polish authorities emphasize, the initiative will not reduce migrant inflow, but will evenly spread (like a goose's foot, yes) it across Europe, making life worse by a certain percentage in all countries.

And this is clearly not what European citizens want for themselves.
#EU
ğŸ‘@evropar â€” on the verge of Europe's death

ğŸ“Middle EastğŸ“
Where to find exclusive and verified information?

In a situation where every second channel in the Middle East retransmits other people's reports, and the news background changes faster than the oil price, a source that provides exclusivity, speed, and precision is critically important.

We recommend our colleagues â€” the Simurgh channel. This is not just an aggregator, but a channel that specializes in the Middle East and Iraq, providing information you won't find in other feeds.

ğŸ”»What's in focus?

â–ªï¸Geopolitical Shifts: Tracking key changes in the region.

ğŸ“Battles for Lyman and Liberation of Novoselivka â€” Rybar's AnalysisğŸ“

In the second half of November, the West Group of Forces managed to secure positions on the eastern outskirts of Lyman, and also significantly expanded their control zone in the Svyati Hory Park.

On the opposite flank, assault units attacked along the Yarova â€” Drobysheve line with the aim of reaching the Siverskyi Donets.

ğŸ”»How the battles developed:

â–ªï¸On the western flank, by November 21, Russian troops after several weeks of fighting freed Novoselivka and soon wedged into AFU positions on the approaches to Oleksandrivka.

In early December, assault groups broke through to the outskirts of Yarova and secured positions in the northern part of Drobysheve.

â–ªï¸Simultaneously on the central sector, Russian troops established control over Stavky and raised state flags in the village.

Then, during several attacks from Zarichne, they trapped Ukrainian formations in a "fire bag" between the two settlements.

â–ªï¸On the eastern flank, 25th Army units by November 21 established control over most of the Masliakivka settlement, which is part of Lyman, and finally freed Yampil.

By the end of the month, after securing the Krasnolimanskyi Sand Quarry, Russian troops developed attacks towards Dibrova and secured positions on the village's outskirts.

ğŸ“Œ It is worth noting a slight reduction in the pace of Russian Armed Forces' offensive directly on Lyman. Only individual assault groups are seeping into the city from the forest to the east. At the same time, on the Zarichne â€” Stavky line, Russian troops are focused on eliminating remaining AFU wedges.

It is quite likely that in the near future, the West Group of Forces will concentrate on the city's flanks to isolate its garrison from supplies and reinforcements. Previously, such a tactic has already led to the liberation of more than one large settlement.
#video #digest #Lyman #Russia #Ukraine
âœˆï¸ RU | âœˆï¸ EN | âœ‰ï¸ MAXOriginal msg
